symptoms.name: Painless skin lesion
symptoms.pattern: Single or few, sharply demarcated, hypoesthetic or anesthetic lesions

physical_findings: Slightly hypopigmented papule on the inner surface of the left knee
Residual actinic keratosis and regions of sun damage on arms and legs
No significant findings on peripheral nerve examination or hot and cold testing

lab_values.Histopathology: Prominent granulomatous inflammation consisting of epithelioid histiocytes and associated small, mature lymphocytes. Focal admixed neutrophils present. Polarizable foreign material not seen.
lab_values.FITE stain: Innumerable positive mycobacteria clustered in small granules and as single organisms
lab_values.AFB stain: Foamy macrophages seen. Negative in one instance, suggesting potential sampling variation or a rare mixed leprosy form.

risk_factors: Extensive travel to Africa and Asia

required: Granulomatous inflammation with epithelioid histiocytes and lymphocytes on histopathology
Single or few, sharply demarcated hypoesthetic or anesthetic lesions
